Job Title: Low Latency Network Engineer (24 Months Contract)
Job Description:
Low Latency Network Engineer (Ultra Low\Low Latency Data Centre)
As a Network Engineer you'll provide solutions across the company's datacenters and global colocation estate across the world encompassing all aspects related to collocation sites: site access, equipment procurement, logistics, capacity management (power, space, servers, network ports, etc.), performance management, service availability, connectivity, compute and market data delivery.

You will architect, engineer and deploy ultra-low latency network infrastructure including overseeing and carrying-out installation, monitoring, maintenance, support, optimization and documentation of all network hardware, security hardware, software and connectivity. You will also get involved with managing\participating in multiple projects and be responsible for configuring / optimizing the network to ensure ultra-low\low latency is achieved for intraday trading and direct market access systems, providing exchange, broker and managed service providers connectivity to support market data delivery and order execution.

Requirements:
20+ years in the relevant field and/or experience
Strong knowledge on Electronic and Algo Trading Platforms, Feed Handlers, Order Routers, Smart Order Routers, FIX protocol.
Exchange binary FIX protocols such as OUCH, ITCH.
Strong Network engineering and project delivery experience
Advanced knowledge of routing and switching protocols;
Experience with Unicast: EIGRP, OSPF, BGP, NAT, IPSEC and GRE
Heavy experience with Multicast: PIM, RP, MSDP, IGMP v2, v3
Experience with Switching: STP, PC/vPC/MLAG, CDP/LLDP, QoS, HSRP/VRRP, VLAN/VxLAN, Spine and Leaf infrastructures.
In-depth experience with Cisco Nexus network switching, routing hardware and software
Knowledge of network monitoring PCAP decoding tools landscape (Corvil, SFlow, timestamping (PTP) preferred but not required)
Knowledge of Algorithmic/DMA/HFT and trading platforms and how the trade lifecycle operates
Solid understanding of market venue, exchange protocols (binary, FIX, ITCH,OUCH, Pillar, etc.) and trading systems across multiple asset classes
Strong scripting and automation experience (Python preferred but not required)
Excellent communication skills; ability to perform under pressure and detail oriented
While certification are interesting, they are not required as we value experience over certification

Job Description:
Job Description (Roles & Responsibilities)
Serve as a key technical member of the Solutions Architecture team in helping to enable partners and ensure partner success in building partner practice, capabilities, and solutions on the Huawei Cloud platform.
Scope each partner engagement, with attention towards clear and well-defined objectives and success criteria.
Provide the architectural guidance and recommendations necessary to promote successful partner engagements validating POCs, SOWs, new solutions and architecture designs.
Demonstrate vision, creativity, business acumen and deep Huawei Cloud knowledge in jointly developing industry and vertical partner solutions.
Own each technical enablement and engagement, and help ensure a timely and successful delivery of value. (delivery of actual solutions to be done by Huawei partners)
Capture and share best-practice knowledge amongst the solution architect community.
Understand the Huawei market segments, customer base, and industry verticals.
Understand and exploit internal Huawei systems.
Share partner and customer feedback to internal product management and engineering teams to help drive improvements.
As a Partner Solution Architect focused on our strategic alliance partners within Huawei Cloud, you will have the opportunity to help shape and take initiative to produce results on a strategy to build mind share and broad use of the Huawei Cloud platform across our partner community.
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS
Be familiar with the functions, principles, and architecture of one or more domains of the public cloud or private cloud. Basic programming knowledge or development experience is preferred.
Highly technical and analytical, possess 8+ years of current solution architecture (implementation/consulting) experience
Experience in technology/software sales or pre-sales consulting.
Presentation skills with a high degree of comfort speaking with executives, IT Management, and developers
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Experience in working within partner and consulting organizations
Experience in migrating or transforming legacy customer solutions to the cloud
Experience with Huawei Cloud is a plus
Experience in programming or scripting language is a plus.

Job Description:
About the Client
Our client is one of the reputed MNC firms in Singapore
Responsibilities
Functional specification
a. Responsible to analyse and define detailed functional specifications based on the functional and non-functional requirements document.
b. Collaborate with Functional Business Analyst to clarify functional and non-functional requirements.
c. Define and ensure traceability from functional specifications to business requirements.

Technical Design
a. Responsible to create technical design.
b. Ensure technical design adheres to architectural roadmap, Development practices, and security requirements.
c. In case of vendor implementation: Ensure vendor resources create technical design document.
d. Collaborate with developers and infrastructure teams to clarify functional specification and technical design during build, test and deployment phase.
e. Collaborate with Production Support to establish IT operations procedures and document as part of Tech Design.
f. Coordinate execution of threat modeling process with assistance of Security Architect to ensure implementation of safeguards is comprehensive in accordance with threats.

Testing & Scope Management
a. Clarify test findings escalated by Test Manager and classify the findings accordingly (either as a defect or change request).
b. Provide input to impact assessment and estimation for Project Change Request.
c. Work with Test Manager to review test plan and functional test scope.

Key Requirements

Must have :-
• Commitment.
• Minimum 6 years of working experience in application testing, development and delivery.
• Ability to work in a fast-paced, team-oriented environment.

• A strong & assertive communicator in speaking & writing. Analytical mindset and good problem solving skills.
• Delivery experience on medium to large scale projects.
• Ability to understand and articulate process flows and functions.
• Strong communication and coordination skills across internal and external stakeholders and vendors.

Good to have :-

• Experience in working in vendor environment.
• 1 - 2 years working experience with AML will be nice to have.

Essential Technical Skill :-

• Experience with Oracle PL/SQL, Oracle SQL.
• Batch Scripting, Control M, DevOps.
• Prior experience with AML Applications: NetReveal, Detica, Mantas etc.

Job Description:
Security Infrastructure Analyst
Main Duties
As an expert of his/her team, he/she:
assigns technical tasks and manages delegation for technical issues,
animates the team to encourage collaboration and sharing of best practices,
has a role in supporting technical skills development and provides training when required,
supports new technologies and leverages them to provide consistency of service across streams,
manages service improvements for all Network and Security services supported throughout the organization,
documents,reviews, maintains and shares relevant technical information to the team
provides technical direction, supports services both proactively and reactively to maintain the availability and reliability of system infrastructure in accordance with the SLA,
implements and develops improvements based on best practices,
focuses on automation and optimum use of the team to improve efficiency,
drives and delivers root cause for any high severity issue,
reviews technology changes to identify potential risks,
is responsible for problem management and resolution
Perform real-time analysis and trending of security systems
Respond to user incident reports and evaluates the type and severity of security events.
Identify recurring security issues and risks and develops mitigation plans and recommends process improvements.
Interpret and apply security policies and procedures.
Establish escalation processes for security incidents and develops contingency plans and disaster recovery procedures.
As an experienced professional in Network-Security Services, he/she:
supports his/her team during diagnosis when technical issues rise in his/her scope of expertise,
is aware of the global IT structure so that he/she anticipates interrelationships within the organization,
engages with technical peer, Service managers, Architect and project teams on technology roadmap and projects,
facilitates transformation projects and suggest future directions for new areas of improvement and change,
guarantees the production readiness and license to operate of new projects and solutions
is available and able to drive technically, any complex or high severity incidents that occur within the scope of their role,
actively assists in identifying the most technical skilled candidates for open roles,
Legal and Regulatory Responsibilities
Comply with all applicable legal, regulatory and internal Compliance requirements, including, but not limited to, the Singapore Compliance manual and Compliance policies and procedures as issued from time to time;Financial Security requirements, including, but not limited to, the prevention of Financial Crime and Fraud including reporting obligations to the Money Laundering Reporting Officer.
Maintain appropriate knowledge to ensure to be fully qualified to undertake the role. Complete all mandatory training as required to attain and maintain competence.
Qualifications and Profile
15+ years of Experience in managing network and security infra.
10+ years Experience in handling major network security projects (ex: SDWAN )
10+ years Experience in handling Firewalls/IPS/F5/Pulse/Proxies, Routers/Switches.
Atleast a Bachelor’s degree in any of these faculties:
Computer Science
Information Technology
Programming & Systems Analysis
Science (Computer Studies)

Job Title: Head of Global Business Development [Renewable Energy]
Job Description:
Are you ready to be a driving force in the future of renewable energy?

Step into a transformative role as the Head of of Business Development with our established client, where you will shape sustainable solutions, manage high-impact projects, and collaborate closely with executive leadership to make a lasting difference!

Work Location: Singapore (International Travel Required)
Bilingual proficiency in English and Mandarin would be essential to manage Chinese/Taiwan stakeholders
ONLY Singaporean can be considered due to project requirements


Role Summary

The Head of Global Business Development (function as General Manager) drives the company’s global growth strategy, expanding its presence in the renewable energy sector. Reporting directly to the COO and Chairman, this executive role leads the BD team in identifying and executing high-value opportunities, cultivating strategic partnerships, and overseeing the acquisition of permits and compliance clearances for sustainable energy projects across markets.

Key Responsibilities:
Strategic Leadership & Market Expansion
Design and implement global business development strategies to penetrate emerging markets and expand the company’s footprint in renewable energy.
Lead efforts in market analysis, identifying and pursuing high-impact business opportunities such as mergers, acquisitions, joint ventures, and new revenue channels.
Engage with government bodies, regulators, and stakeholders to develop and maintain crucial relationships that facilitate project approvals and expansions.

Global Partnerships & Relationship Management
Forge and sustain strategic partnerships with key stakeholders, including government entities, corporate partners, and industry associations.
Lead negotiations for high-value contracts and partnerships, ensuring alignment with project objectives and regulatory compliance across international markets.
Serve as the executive liaison with international partners, ensuring the alignment of project goals and overseeing the smooth execution of collaborative initiatives.

Project Oversight & Execution
Oversee the full project lifecycle for global renewable energy projects, from feasibility studies and risk assessments to final delivery.
Implement best practices in project management to ensure compliance with regulatory requirements, maintaining timelines and budget parameters.
Establish and maintain oversight processes to monitor progress, troubleshoot issues, and ensure that projects achieve their business and environmental goals.

Team Leadership & Development
Lead and mentor the global business development team, fostering a culture of innovation, collaboration, and commitment to excellence.
Provide strategic oversight to ensure that team members meet project deliverables within set timelines.
Drive cross-functional alignment with other departments to ensure cohesive project execution and alignment with the company’s strategic objectives.


The Ideal candidate profile:

Advanced Degree in Engineering Management, Business, or a related field; an MBA or equivalent is highly desirable.
At least 10 years of demonstrated success in global business development, strategy, and project management within the renewable energy or related sectors/services.
Proven leadership experience in managing and developing high-performing cross-functional teams in a global business environment.
Deep understanding of global regulatory environments, renewable energy technologies, and industry trends, with a proactive interest in environmental sustainability.
Exceptional negotiation, communication, and interpersonal skills, capable of engaging at all organizational levels.
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic global setup;
Willingness to travel frequently for land assessments, negotiations, and governmental meetings.


All applications will be treated in the strictest confidence.
We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Job Title: Head of Sales Plastic Additives, South & South East Asia
Company: BASF SOUTH EAST ASIA PTE. LTD.
Job Description:
About The Role
Lead a sustainable, high-performing sales team for the Plastic Additives business across the South & South East Asia sub-region, fostering a culture of accountability, entrepreneurship, and continuous improvement.
Achieve sustainable, profitable business growth for the Plastic Additives business in subregion South & South East Asia in line with overall business objectives.
Hunt and nurture the new business potentials in the market
Ensure that safety and compliance to all relevant policies have the highest priority.

How You Will Do It
Leadership:
Lead, mentor and motivate the sales team to achieve and exceed sales targets and KPIs. As a member of the regional Business Leadership Team, provide insights and recommendations to drive profitability and strategic direction.
Accountable for the development of skills and competencies of the team
Financial Performance:
Establish and deliver financial targets for the sales team while managing resources effectively to optimize profitability short and long term. Conduct regular financial and market analyses to drive informed decision-making that enhances profitability.
Strategy Development:
Develop and implement a comprehensive sales strategy for the South & South East Asia region that aligns with overall business objectives. Oversee market research and competitive analysis to identify market trends, customer needs, and potential opportunities and threats. Utilize data and insights to inform and adjust the sales strategy as necessary.
Customer Relationship Management:
Build and maintain strong relationships with key customers, distributors, and stakeholders. Ensure customer satisfaction through effective communication and problem-solving strategies.
Collaboration and Communication:
Work closely with other relevant teams to ensure alignment of sales strategy and operational capability. Report on sales performance, market insights, and growth opportunities to the executive team.
Safety and Compliance:
Adhere to corporate guidelines to ensure safety at all levels and ensure that all employees are fully aware of the importance of safety protocols. Regularly review safety topics with the team and ensure that all activities are conducted in a safe and compliant manner.

What We Look For
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in chemistry, engineering or business-related field. MBA is preferred.
A minimum of 10 years of recent experience in sales or business management within the chemicals industry across Asia is preferred, including at least 5 years in a leadership role with responsibility for P&L. Previous experience across multiple business functions is preferred, for example, product management, procurement, production, supply chain, marketing, strategy and/or controlling.
Proven track record of achieving sales targets and driving profitable growth in the chemicals industry.
Strong understanding of market dynamics, customer needs, and competitive landscapes in the chemicals sector.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, capable of influencing and collaborating with diverse teams and stakeholders.
Strong financial acumen with a deep understanding of economic principles
Strong project and change management skills are a plus
Ability to work in a multicultural environment
Able to frequently travel within the region

Job Description:
Our client is a global leader committed to continuously deliver innovations to customers’ businesses worldwide, for creating innovative and fulfilling workplaces by effectively adopting information and knowledge through digital transformation (DX). They have pioneered numerous technologies and accumulated expertise since their establishment in 1962, to build an environment that encourages the use of one’s creativity to maximize organizational strengths. Their portfolio includes conducting R&D, manufacturing and sales of world-class workflow solutions, IT services, and printing equipment such as digital multifunction printers (MFPs). They also offer business process outsourcing (BPO) services as well as marketing and implementation support of Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) systems.


PURPOSE:

Lead the technical Specialist team in providing all services support, act as the main contact with 3rd party operational support and administer team resources for BAU support and assigned projects. The candidate is also expected to provide activity and issue reporting to the Senior Manager and Management.
The role also requires the candidate to support RSSI innovation’s vision, strategy and initiatives in alignment to the business growth and expansion. This include both customer and internal facing across APAC entities.

RESPONSIBILITIES & TASKS:
Manage and lead the Technical Specialist team and when necessary lends the additional hands to undertake support and testing activities both customer and internal facing.
As the team lead, you will be involved in ensuring support tickets is effectively managed from start to finish to support country based technical staff.
Support business side as an SME including meetings with customer IT teams and provide guidance to the Technical Specialist.
Manage the technical aspects of product launch which involves installing, testing, learning and understanding the software, understanding its purpose and the preparation of required documents and training material as well deliver required training to meet the business needs.
Evaluate innovation opportunities of existing service offerings, bringing technological aspects of product integration and value add services.
Providing technical support on deals from RFP, contracting, implementation through to BAU where needed.
You will also support UAT and release management of the core software used for service delivery.
Responsibilities will varies based on business dynamics and expected adoption to changing requirements and demands is necessary.

Additional Roles & Responsibilities:

Based on your performance, you will undertake a larger responsibility in leading key service initiative and solution 3rd level support that is key to FujiFilm business.
Be part of the leading team in supporting Guardia 3rd level operation support across countries’ implementation.
Undertake key feature testing and validation of ALL regional services that falls under the purview of the Technology Management team.
Provide Technical Service support during BAU for all customer account in the region.
Provide Technical leadership in key customers projects.

Requirements:
Degree in information technology, engineering or equivalent
ITIL, TOGAF and Infrastructure/Network Security technologies certification would be an advantage.
At least 10 years’ experience in a technical lead role and at least 5 years as team manager.
Good experience and understanding of Microsoft Infrastructure Technology platforms like Security Certificates, PKI technology, DNS, DHCP and AD services.
At least 5 years proven experience in troubleshooting technology incidents and problem management.
Cloud technology experience, esp Azure and AWS
Experience with Ysoft SafeQ 6
Good understanding of PKI technologies and concepts
Experience in delivering training
Experience in leading technology transformation projects in a cross functional domain experts’ environment
Experience with Windows Server environments
Experience with IIS and MSQL
Knowledge of networking, ports, and protocols.
Good English written and verbal communication skills.

Job Description:
Role and Responsibilities:

Programme Management:

Oversight of the IT programme, track the projects’ progress to ensure projects are on track and aligned with overall IT programme timeline.
Identify, track and manage the risks, assumptions, issues and dependencies for the overall IT programme.
Coordinate activities among different projects and supporting the system integration between systems.

Work Plan and Budgeting:

Work with relevant parties (delivery teams, vendors, ops users, etc) to plan and budget the decommissioning of application systems that will no longer used, decanding of services/facilities within systems, and commissioning of new services/facilities
Collate business requirements of stakeholders, including working with delivery teams for solution review board submissions, ITQ/RFP submissions, and approval papers.
Work with delivery teams to obtain the costings, including review the cost reasonableness.
Work with relevant parties (vendors, delivery teams,ministry etc) to advise users on adoption of technologies/systems/national initiatives.
Project Delivery:

Work with relevant parties (delivery teams, vendors, ops users, etc) to procure, perform installation, setup, testing and full-dress rehearsals of application systems for the commissioning of new services / facilities
Facilitate and participate in cluster / institution workflow study, workgroup discussion to provide IT advice, including driving National IT initiatives adoption.
Plan and track the required activities for IT readiness, deployment, and implementation.
Tracking of key performance indicators for institution / cluster projects such as timely project delivery, quality of systems delivered, user satisfaction of systems delivered, etc.
Management and reporting of project development, maintenance and support activities.
Support users in user acceptance testing (UAT), and system integration testing between different systems.
Work with users and delivery teams to resolve IT issues and timely resolution / implementation.
Ensure IT systems and implementation adhere to thepolicies, standards, and guidelines, supporting the Security risk Assessment and Solution Review Board (SRB) approval for projects.
Support the activities for operation transition, business continuity planning (BCP), full dress rehearsal and hospital go-live.
Others:

Perform a secretariat role for the Campus Development meetings.
Prepare and present the required materials for relevant forums in the institution/cluster (eg. IT committees, management meetings, steering comm meetings, etc)
Support and manage ad-hoc IT requests from institution/cluster, IT issues resolution etc.
Support audit requests as raised from internal / external audits.
Undertake any requests as directed and in alignment with organization objectives and goals.

Requirements / Qualifications

Bachelor Degree in Computer Science or equivalent (IT related field preferred)
Strong experience in project management
Excellent problem solving skills (including troubleshooting in IT related context).
Excellent written/communication and interpersonal skill
Strong organisational and customer service skills
Able to lead and work with cross functional teams

Job Description:
About the Client:
An exciting opportunity for a Project Executive (Telecom Roll Out) has opened up at a leading provider of essential network services, offering a long-term contract with the potential for extension.
Responsibilities:
To support the efficient management and execution of telecom rollout projects by analyzing data, ensuring compliance with regulations, and maintaining accurate project documentation and tools.
Key Responsibilities:
Translate project planning inputs and contractual terms into clear customer deliverables, ensuring they align with legal and security requirements.
Collaborate with the Project Manager to establish operational cadence, critical paths, and milestones for effective project planning.
Analyze financial and delivery progress to monitor and improve project performance, providing timely and accurate reports to stakeholders.
Maintain project administration by updating the Customer Deliverable Master List, creating work plans, and supporting documentation and compliance.
Manage and configure planning tools, validate project setup, and ensure accurate data maintenance in project administration tools.
To succeed in the Project Executive (Telecom Rollout) role, you will need to have strong analytical abilities, proficiency in project management tools, excellent organizational skills, and a thorough understanding of telecom project planning and compliance requirements.
Skills/Requirement:

Bachelor's degree in project management, telecommunications, or a related field, with experience in telecom project planning and execution.
Strong analytical skills to assess project inputs, legal impacts, and operational progress, providing data-driven insights and recommendations.
Proficiency in project management tools and software, with the ability to configure and validate project setups.
Excellent organizational skills to manage project documentation and effective communication skills to collaborate with the stakeholders.
If you’re excited about project planning, enjoy a challenging project and appreciate the satisfaction that comes with it, we would love to hear from you.

Job Description:
We are representing our client (one of Asia’s largest diversified Real Estate groups headquartered in Singapore) to look for an experience Property Operations Manager to join their dynamic team in commercial operations.

Property Operations Manager (Grade A Commercial Building)
Office Location: Central

Responsibilities
Financial Management/Reporting
Responsible for planning, monitoring and maintaining the operational and capital expenditures of the buildings as assigned
People Management
Lead and supervise a team of Property Executives, Senior Admin Assistants, Senior Technicians and/or Technicians in buildings as assigned
Supervises maintenance works to ensure that contract service providers perform all contractual obligations under various term contracts

Building Operations
Conduct routine inspection of mechanical, electrical, fire protection and plumbing and sanitary services
Plan preventive works schedule, conduct and supervise inspections to buildings as assigned and grounds to identify defects/irregularities and follow-up on rectification works
Lead site inspections and provide inputs to the planning and execution of Maintenance Works, Building Improvement Works, Annual Building Inspections and Periodic Structural Inspections
Assist the Centre Manager in implementation and compliance to ISO 9001, ISO 14001 and ISO 45001.
Plan and implement initiatives to achieve the energy and water saving targets for the property
Part of Company Emergency Response Team ( i.e. SMC, SIC, FSM )

Administration
Assist the Centre Manager in the preparation of Building Action Plan & operational budget and ensure that expenses are spent within budget
Upkeep and maintain building operation manual and other records relating to buildings as assigned and its facilities
Raise work order, monitor repair and maintenance works by contractors and certify work completion for release of payment
Administer the processing of A & A works, provide technical evaluation, monitor and ensure work completion in accordance with A&A Permits and relevant governmental requirements
Administer other A & A related issues including the maintenance of proper records of tenants’ A&A submissions, renovation deposits and release of renovation deposits
Assist the Centre Manager on term contract administration including evaluation of contractors’ performance and review of contract specifications
Approve monthly overtime and time-off claims

Tenancy Matters
Attend to tenants’ requests, feedbacks and marketing request promptly
Conduct inspections for the handing and taking over of tenanted premises
Assist the Centre Manager in liaising with external parties on matters relating to the buildings as assigned
Requirements
Degree or Diploma in Electrical/ Mechanical/ Building Services Engineering/Estate Management / Project & Facilities Management or equivalent
Senior Fire Safety Manager Certificate ( SFSM )
Strong building and M&E knowledge and hands-on experience
Experience in management of commercial buildings ( Grade A )
Good interpersonal and presentation skills
Strong leadership
Able to work independently and to interact with people of all levels

Job Title: Sales Director - Private Markets / Real Estate
Job Description:
About Us
Leading independent Fund Administration business with offices in multiple jurisdictions including London, Dublin, Luxembourg, Jersey, Guernsey, Singapore, Hong Kong, Australia, Luxembourg and Cayman
Looking for a New Business Development Director with a proven track record to join as a senior member of the sales team. The new Business Development Director will be tasked with identifying and winning Private Equity and Real Estate Fund Administration mandates
The preferred candidate must have closed-ended funds sales experience, a CFO/COO and key intermediary network and be capable of building a significant pipeline of new business, working alongside dedicated subject matter experts and support teams
With significant resources, a highly supportive culture, scalable infrastructure and a rapidly expanding Private Equity, Real Estate and Investment Management client base, the role offers a long term career with significant earnings potential, an excellent commission structure and a competitive salary
Responsibilities
Develop a strong pipeline of potential clients in the closed-ended fund space with a focus on profitable new revenue generation
Identify and win new business mainly in Asia(or other assigned region(s) as required), targeting both new fund launches and established funds across the private equity, private debt, real estate, venture capital and funds of funds space
Build a network and pipeline in the Limited Partners (LP) space to position the firm’s portfolio administration service offering
Take ownership of the sales process and lead commercial negotiations in line with internally agreed parameters
Help build the firm’s brand and increase brand awareness to generate quality leads
Attendance and participation at industry events
Develop and manage the intermediary and third-party services provider network
Participate in the private equity team thought leadership initiatives by writing topical articles pertinent to the industry
Experience
Proven track record generating new revenue in the closed-ended fund arena of outsourced fund administration and accounting services
Competencies
The ideal candidate will be a self-starter, a quick learner and will be expected to establish and maintain relationships with key influencers in the industry
Self-motivated and driven to deliver strong sales results

Job Title: Application Developer JAVA / .NET (12 months agency contract), Code : KAS
Job Description:
Responsibilities:

• The design, development and implementation of applications related changes to agreed timeframes and standards.

• Responsible for peer code reviews to ensure the quality of the code deployed in the NEMS systems.

• Working closely with the Applications team and internal business users to ensure changes are developed in a way that that provides maximum benefit to the company, in a cost-effective, secured and operationally “risk-free” manner.

• Providing assessments on the impact and risk of potential changes to the systems and the business as a whole.

• Creation of concise detailed system specifications for changes that solve business needs and implementing changes to these agreed specifications.

• Following strict change control and version control processes to ensure quality changes are implemented in an auditable manner.

• Be outspoken in providing “best practise” recommendations.

• Proactively suggest ways to reduce operational overhead by “streamlining” manual tasks into automated procedures.

• Providing application support to the Operations team whenever necessary.

Requirements:

• Degree (IT) or Equivalent Formal Training.

• Strong applications development experience with at least 8 years of development work experience with the following tools and technologies:

o J2EE, Java, PrimeFaces, JSP, Servlets, JMS, Angular, SpringBoot, PL/SQL, java Microservice, REST API, XML, XSL, EJB, Struts, Hibernate, J2EE Design Patterns, Java Security, Oracle DB19C, Oracle Weblogic / DB11g and 12C, JBoss EAP 7.0 Eclipse, Container based architecture

• Experience on Applications security throughout the development lifecycle and ability to enhance applications to meet the security best practices.

• Highly motivated to provide complete solutions to customers. Being able to talk to users and understand their requirements is essential.

• The ability to manage oneself during projects from start to finish, throughout the whole development lifecycle.

• Experience with software configuration management principles and systems.

• Experience with test methodologies and tools.

• Experience with implementing medium to large scale projects. (i.e. project that span across at least 6 calendar months with at least 2 full developers and above)

Job Description:
Key Responsibilities:

Legal
· Manage all legal matters for the Group’s business, including M&As, JVs and other investments
· Manage broad range of general corporate legal matters, such as drafting, reviewing, advising on and negotiating corporate and commercial transaction agreements
· Provide advice to mitigate legal risk and manage litigation matters and proceedings
· Manage trademarks registration
· Provide advice on the relevant laws/rules/restrictions
· Ensure the Group stays compliant with regulatory requirements under the Companies Act, Listing Rules and related laws and regulations
· Liaise with and manage external counsels in various jurisdictions on various legal matters
· Advise and conduct training on the Companies Act and related laws and regulation including the preparation of training materials.
· Participate in the legal & compliance department’s knowledge management exercise
· Drive and support continuous improvement initiatives, such as reviewing policies and processes of the legal function, collating and analysing data, preparing reports and policy papers, for the general improvement of the legal function and processes
· All necessary reporting and liaison with listed parent company and catalist sponsor in relation to the above responsibilities
Compliance
· Ensure that the Group’s compliance policies are implemented across the Group
· Draft policies/guidance, suggest appropriate controls and ensure compliance controls are implemented
· Keep track of regulatory developments and update existing compliance policies and procedures accordingly
· Handle full spectrum of corporate secretarial matters for the Group, including its local and overseas subsidiaries and associate companies such as:
· Draft various resolutions, minutes of meetings, SGX announcements, filing of statutory returns, annual report and liaison with regulators and the board on corporate governance and compliance matters
· Organise and co-ordinate directors’ and shareholders’ meetings, including attending and preparing board and sub-committee meetings papers and AGM/EGM meeting documents
· Manage communication and relationships with shareholders, including handling inquiries, coordinating shareholder meetings, and maintaining the register of members
· Maintain and file the corporate secretariat records and support periodic audit exercise
· Liaise with and manage registered agents in various jurisdictions on various corporate secretarial matters
Risk Management
· Oversee, co-ordinate and facilitate risk management activities
· Collect risk exposure and risk management information to provide risk reports to internal stakeholders
· Facilitate risk identification and assessment exercises
· Design and implement risk management processes & draft risk management policies and procedures
· Any other ad-hoc duties as assigned from time to time

Requirements:
· Bachelor’s Degree in Law
· Admission to the bar in a common law jurisdiction will be an advantage but not essential
· At least 3-4 years of relevant experience in corporate commercial law acquired in-house or in a law firm
· Sound knowledge of legal advice in general corporate advisory work, including company and contract law
· Familiarity with SGX Listing Rules and Regulations is advantageous
· Completed ICSA or relevant post graduate/ professional qualifications will be an advantage
· Able to organise and prioritise work
· Possess a flexible and proactive attitude
· Able to work independently and be a team player
· Good communication and interpersonal skills
· Good written and spoken English and Mandarin to effectively communicate with international and Chinese affiliates and business partners
· Able to maintain confidentiality on all legal and corporate secretarial matters

Job Title: Junior Data Analyst - 12 Months Contract - up to SGD5.5k - West
Job Description:
Morgan McKinley is looking for a skilled Data Analyst for a 12-months contract with our client in the tech industry.

Responsibilities:
Develop data-driven hypotheses to address key product and business challenges.
Analyze data to identify trends, detect anomalies, and uncover root causes.
Collaborate closely with product and engineering teams to design and analyze experiments that inform product decisions, and explore existing data to propose impactful product ideas.
Define and oversee frontend and backend data specifications for new products, ensuring seamless collaboration with engineering teams for accurate and timely data collection. Integrate data from various sources to create scalable, decision-driving dashboards.
Provide detailed analysis for specific products and operations, establish and rigorously track critical business metrics, and offer actionable recommendations for continuous improvement.
Enhance internal processes through automation, establish stable data pipelines, and ensure data quality to improve overall productivity.
Qualifications:
With 1–2 years of experience in data analytics roles involving large datasets, with experience in map-making, ride-hailing, or delivery industries being a plus.
Strong statistical foundation, attention to detail with data, and expertise in running experiments.
Proficient in data visualization, with hands-on experience creating dashboards using tools like Tableau, Power BI, or similar platforms.
Advanced SQL skills and experience with scripting languages such as Python or R.
Proven experience in building and maintaining data pipelines to support various projects.
Problem-solving mindset with the ability to design creative, timely solutions for complex tasks.
Strong communication skills to effectively present analytical findings and convey insights.
Self-motivated and capable of working independently, driving projects with minimal supervision.

Job Description:
ABOUT
As a leading financial software company, NeoXam delivers data management and transaction software solutions to financial institutions located in Europe, America, and Asia Pacific. Every day, NeoXam helps to process more than $14 trillion worth of assets for over 10,000 user accounts across the globe.
Headquartered in Paris, NeoXam expanded its business to China in 2009 and established Singapore’s office in 2017 (now APAC HQ). Supported by over 550 employees globally including 70 staff in APAC, the company continues to grow and is looking for local talents to join our Singapore’s office to pursue this rewarding journey through an internship which would lead to a working contract for the best performers. Candidates will have the opportunity to join a multicultural dynamic team working in an entrepreneurial spirit on one of the best worldwide multi-awarded Data Management and Investment Book of Record solution (Datahub) used by the largest financial institutions globally.

JOB DESCRIPTION
NeoXam is looking for an experienced and motivated Senior Consultant who will be based in Singapore office. The role will work closely with the account management, the services team and collaborate with the product teams. With the experience and potential, he/she will join a team of experienced consultants and participate in the implementation and support of the solution, the configuration of new modules and features using:
NeoXam DataHub: the most comprehensive, efficient and customizable solution for centralized data management available on the market. The solution acts as a hub, a central repository and a useroriented data management tool for data used or produced by financial institutions.
NeoXam IBOR: a uniquely independent and flexible Investment Book of Record, designed to provide Asset Managers with a single, comprehensive, and robust source of continuously up-to-date positions, valuations and forecasts, with increased quality, under multiple views.


RESPONSIBILITIES
Accountable for high-impacting and challenging implementation projects, and acquire a global vision of the business processes at the world’s top financial firms
Provide best practice guidance to clients by leveraging technical expertise, NeoXam DataHub software knowledge and industry experience
Design, configure, implement NeoXam’s DataHub software solutions based on client requirements
Identify and resolve any installation and implementation problems to the client’s satisfaction within established time frames
Manage the overall design and configuration activity by ensuring the team follows configuration / scripting / design guidelines
Analyze the clients’ needs, accompany and coach their teams and/or take charge of the product implementation, meet clients’ requests, manage the client relation and coordination of the project.
Provide project management leadership under the responsibility of the Account Manager or Project Director
Develop and conduct product training workshops for clients
Provide presales consultancy by assisting the sales teams with presentations, Proof of Concept, implementation expertise, etc.

WE OFFER
Competitive compensation
Excellent medical, dental and maternity coverage for you and your dependents
Life insurance, allowance
A co-working space filled with multinational companies / startups / entrepreneurs, located next to Raffles Place MRT
A collaborative, collegial and fun-loving office culture
An exposure to diverse technical and functional areas

PROFILE
Computer Science, Engineering or Business school, Master’s degree or equivalent
Minimum 10 years of experience with software implementation and IT Projects in the banking / financial industry within APAC region. Preferably those with a financial technology vendor or consulting company background.
Capable of writing rules in scripting language like VBA
Experience with RDBMS, Data Modeling, and SQL language
Understanding of Enterprise Data Management and ETL techniques and processes
Previous experience of financial data provider feeds such as Bloomberg, Refinitiv, ICE and others
Knowledge of financial instruments such as Equities, Fixed Income and Derivatives
Previous project experience with involvement in multiple stages of the project life cycle
Independent, with own initiative and good interpersonal skills and are concerned about the quality of service provided
Proactive and a real team player
Fluent in English
Knowledge in French language is advantageous because the role will collaborate with Product team headquartered in Paris

Job Description:
ABOUT
As a leading financial software company, NeoXam delivers data management and transaction software solutions to financial institutions located in Europe, America, and Asia Pacific. Every day, NeoXam helps to process more than $14 trillion worth of assets for over 10,000 user accounts across the globe.
Headquartered in Paris, NeoXam expanded its business to China in 2009 and established Singapore’s office in 2017 (now APAC HQ). Supported by over 600 employees globally including 80 staff in APAC, the company continues to grow and is looking for local talents to join our Singapore’s office to pursue this rewarding journey through an internship which would lead to a working contract for the best performers. Candidates will have the opportunity to join a multicultural dynamic team working in an entrepreneurial spirit on one of the best worldwide multi-awarded Data Management and Investment Book of Record solution (Datahub) used by the largest financial institutions globally.

JOB DESCRIPTION
NeoXam Singapore is looking for an experienced and motivated Neoxam Datahub Software & Application Manager who will lead the team working on Enhancement and Support of NeoXam Datahub Entity Master. This role will be based in Singapore, working closely together with the NeoXam project team.

He / she will join a team of experienced consultants and participate in the implementation and support of the application, the installation of new modules and features using NeoXam DataHub: the most comprehensive, efficient and customizable solution for centralized data management available on the market. The solution acts as a hub, a central repository and a user-oriented data management tool for data used or produced by financial institutions.

MISSION & MAIN ACTIVITIES
Lead the team working on Enhancement and Support of NeoXam Datahub Entity Master
Writing and implementing modified codes to meet client’s requirement
Developing quality assurance procedures
Working closely with Research & Development (R&D) team on the improvements of NeoXam software solutions
Implementing and managing NeoXam Datahub software
Test and evaluate the success of software implementation
Run analysis on installation and implementation problems to identify and resolve technical issues within the established time frames to meet clients’ satisfaction
Identifying areas which requires modification in existing programs and subsequently work with R&D team on these modifications
Provide best practice guidance to clients by leveraging technical expertise, NeoXam software knowledge and industry experience
Ensure coordination and responsive follow-up to client needs and requirements, interfacing with the appropriate NeoXam departments and colleagues as needed
Communicate NeoXam’s offerings and identify new opportunities to grow
Participate in support efforts
Continuously keep up to date with NeoXam DataHub functional and technical features and improvements
Identify and resolve any installation and implementation problems to the clients satisfaction within established time frames
Manage the overall design and configuration activity by ensuring the team follows configuration / scripting / design guidelines
Analyze the clients’ needs, accompany and coach their teams and/or take charge of the product implementation, meet clients’ requests, manage the client relation and coordination of the project

Minimum of 4 years of successful implementation and support of NeoXam Datahub solution at customers worldwide
Minimum 8-10 years of experience with Financial software implementation and IT Projects in the banking / financial industry.
Strong analytical and problem solving skillsExperience of a development language (Java, C, C++…) is required to be capable of writing rules in scripting language
Experience with RDBMS, Data Modeling, and SQL language
Understanding of Enterprise Data Management and ETL techniques and processes
Previous experience of financial data provider feeds such as Bloomberg, Refinitiv, ICE and others
Knowledge of financial instruments such as Equities, Fixed Income and Derivatives
Previous project experience with involvement in multiple stages of the project life cycle
Independent, with own initiative and good interpersonal skills and are concerned about the quality of service provided
Proactive and a real team player
Fluent in English
WE OFFER
Competitive compensation
Excellent medical, dental and maternity coverage for you and your dependents
Life insurance, allowance
A co-working space filled with multinational companies / startups / entrepreneurs, located next to Raffles Place MRT
A collaborative, collegial and fun-loving office culture
An exposure to diverse technical and functional areas
At NeoXam, we love people who are curious, involved and self-driven, who like to propose solutions and for whom it is essential to continue to learn and grow on a daily basis.
The position requires rigour, tenacity and a good ability to communicate and promote best practices.

Company: BUSINESS EDGE PERSONNEL SERVICES PTE LTD
Job Description:
Key Responsibilities:
• Arranges and attends handover sessions to confirm, understand and verify the delivery details from relevant parties.
• Arranges and attends kick-off meeting, regular meetings, workshops and/or site surveys with the customer and vendors.
• Prepare delivery details, coordinate related vendors, perform pre-deployment test and ensure any dependencies has been addressed.

• Ensures consistent and reliable service delivery approach in minimizing risk and cost associated with implementation.
• Facilitates technical design workshops, and pre-defined scope in order to integrate all factory products into an integrated solution.
• Implements and project manages the technical solution from inception to installation.
• Resolves client issues (services / product update or maintenance) via onsite or off site and providing support with projects and/or roll outs.
• Work closely with clients to address and solve technology issues, through utilization of the technical resources available.
• Ensure technical issues are resolved to guaranteeing client satisfaction.
• Ensure that the technical delivery of all services meets quality, scope and service level requirements.
• Ensure that all changes and other customer service requests are fulfilled timely and correctly.
• Leads problem resolution efforts and post-incident reviews.
Knowledge and Attributes:

• Advanced knowledge and understanding of grand design criteria.
• Advanced knowledge of product and/or solution specifications, the detailed design framework and checklist.
• Excellent communicate skills, both verbal and written.
• Ability to plan activities and projects well in advance and take into account possible changing circumstances.
• Ability to maintain a positive outlook at work.
• Ability to work well in a pressurized environment.
• Ability to work hard and put in longer hours when it is necessary.
• Ability to apply active listening techniques such as paraphrasing the message to confirm understanding, probing for further relevant information and refraining from interrupting.
• Ability to adapt to changing circumstances.
• Ability to place client at the forefront of all interactions, understanding their requirements and creating a positive client experience throughout the total client journey.

Academic Qualifications and Certifications:
• Bachelor’s degree or equivalent relevant in Information Technology or Computing or a related field.
• Relevant ITIL certification preferred.

Required Experience:
• Advanced experience required in network/ security/ systems/ storage administration and Monitoring Services within a medium to large ICT organization.
• Advanced experience in management agent, redundancy concepts, remote console architecture, and products within the supported technical domain (such as, Network, Storage, Security etc.).

Job Title: Relationship Manager, External Asset Manager (Private Wealth)
Job Industry: Banking and Finance, Consulting, Professional Services
Job Description:
Our client is an esteemed External Asset Management (EAM) firm whose bespoke solutions include Private Wealth Management, Asset Management, and Fund Management.
With a well-established subsidiary and strong presence in China, our client provides direct access to a robust pipeline of HNW clients actively seeking investment opportunities in Singapore.

To further enhance their offering, our client recently acquired an insurance brokerage firm and now boasts in-house Insurance Specialists dedicated to addressing clients’ Universal Life Insurance and Estate Planning needs, ensuring a holistic wealth management experience.

Additionally, the firm organizes exclusive Client Appreciation and Acquisition Events, fully funded by the company.
This enables their Relationship Managers focus on deepening client relationships and acquiring new prospects without incurring any costs.

By leveraging strategic partnerships with Private Banks, Financial Institutions, and Global Product Providers, they cater to the nuanced needs of Ultra-High Net Worth (UHNW) and High Net Worth (HNW) individuals with a commitment to excellence and discretion.
---
Key Requirements (applicants who do not fulfil these requirements will NOT be considered)
Established Relationships with Accredited Investors, HNW/UHNW Clients, Family Offices, or Institutional Clients
Proven track record as a Relationship Manager in one or more of the following sectors/segments:
Private Banking, Priority-Private or Priority Banking
Others: Corporate Banking / Investment Banking / Securities Firms / Wealth Management / HNW Insurance
Market coverage
Open sky
Remuneration
Full Commissions: Very attractive Revenue Sharing scheme
---
Our Confidential Discussion
Feel free to out to me via 8837 5170.
You are welcome for a chat whether you are ready to move or simply wish to fact-find about EAMs/Family Offices.
We can discuss:
The pros and cons of EAM/Family Office vs Private Banks, and how it impacts/benefits your business
Are the Strengths/Weaknesses in terms of your Profile, your Clients’ Profiles and Needs better suited in EAM/Family Office or Private Bank?
The ecosystem of Products and Solutions available in EAM/Family Office setups
The A-to-Z requirements and processes (Compliance and Operations) in order to onboard clients onto the EAM ecosystem
Your information will be treated in the strictest confidence, and we observe strict protocol of not sending candidates’ profiles without their permission.
Thank you very much for your interest. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Job Industry: Consulting, Environment / Health, General Management, Others
Job Description:
About Us:
TASGLOBAL-SG is a leader in providing innovative marine solutions, specializing in hull cleaning using remotely operated vehicles (ROVs) and other disruptive maritime technologies. Our operations are expanding rapidly across the Asia-Pacific region, and we are looking for a skilled Operations Manager to oversee and optimize our daily operations.
Job Responsibilities:
Manage and oversee all day-to-day operations related to hull cleaning services and ROV deployments in Singapore and the region.
Develop and implement operational procedures, ensuring efficiency and high-quality service delivery.
Coordinate with the sales and marketing teams in Singapore, Manila, and Busan to align operational strategies with business growth initiatives.
Oversee the scheduling, logistics, and coordination of operations, including staffing, equipment, and vessel availability.
Manage 5 supervisors who lead 4 operational teams, which will eventually expand to 5 teams and 1 workshop-bound team.
Develop and oversee training progression for pilot technician competencies, ensuring continuous skill development in ROV operations and maintenance.
Ensure compliance with industry regulations, safety standards, and company protocols across all operational activities.
Implement and promote QHSE (Quality, Health, Safety, and Environment) standards across all operations, ensuring a safe working environment for all employees and adherence to international safety and environmental regulations.
Manage and mentor operations staff, including ROV pilots and technical teams, to improve productivity and maintain high morale.
Ensure reports are sent to clients and stakeholders in a timely manner, keeping them updated on job progress, safety, and operational performance.
Liaise with clients and stakeholders to resolve operational issues and improve service satisfaction.
Monitor operational performance, analyze data, and prepare reports for senior management.
Lead continuous improvement initiatives to enhance operational efficiency, cost-effectiveness, safety, and compliance with QHSE standards.
Implement training programs to develop staff skills, particularly in ROV operation, marine technologies, and safety practices.
Requirements:
Proven experience in an operations management role within the maritime, logistics, or related field.
Must have a Bachelor’s degree (BSc or equivalent) in Marine Engineering, Naval Architect or a related field. Or a Marine Chief Engineer or Master.
Must have a professional certification in QHSE, ISO and Project Management.
Strong understanding of the maritime industry, including hull cleaning, ROV operations, marine services.
Excellent leadership and people management skills, with the ability to lead and motivate a diverse team.
Strong problem-solving and decision-making abilities, with a focus on operational excellence and safety.
Excellent organizational and multitasking skills to manage multiple operations simultaneously.
Strong communication skills to liaise with clients, stakeholders, and team members.
Ability to adapt to a dynamic and fast-paced work environment.
Willingness to travel occasionally for operational purposes.
What We Offer:
Competitive salary and performance-based incentives.
A leadership role with opportunities for career growth in a rapidly expanding company.
A dynamic and collaborative work environment focused on technological innovation in the maritime sector.
Access to advanced ROV technology and marine solutions.
Continuous professional development and training opportunities in QHSE practices.
How to Apply:
Interested candidates are encouraged to submit their CV and cover letter to suhaimee@usmtas.com, quoting "Operations Manager Application" in the subject line.

Company: BUSINESS EDGE PERSONNEL SERVICES PTE LTD
Job Description:
What the role is
The company is a dynamic and forward-thinking organization dedicated to empowering individuals and shaping the future of Singapore's workforce. As a statutory board under the Ministry of Education, the company leads the charge in driving the SkillsFuture movement, a national initiative that promotes lifelong learning and skills development. With a strong focus on innovation and collaboration, the company works closely with employers, training providers, and individuals to create a vibrant ecosystem of learning and growth. By offering a wide range of initiatives, programs, and funding schemes, the company enables individuals to unlock their full potential, acquire new competencies, and stay ahead in a rapidly changing job market.
Join the Data Strategy & Analytics Division (DSAD) team to grow Company into a data-mature organization where we use data pervasively and securely to deliver on our business missions:
Develop and drive Company’s data strategy, including LOIs, data competency, and maintaining strong links with CIO Office
Develop, implement, and maintain a comprehensive data governance and management framework that complies with WOG requirements
Implement Lines of Inquiries
Support data management and exploitation
Develop MLOps and instill best practices

What you will be working on
The Data Scientist in the Data Strategy and Analytics Division reports to the Principal Manager and plays a pivotal role in deriving business insights from large and real-time datasets for fraud and risk management, strategic planning as well as operational efficiency. This position will develop, deploy and maintain data analytic models as well as have opportunities to also collaborate with other public agencies to introduce and enhance data science capabilities (such as Jobs and Skills) for the organisation. As the domain expert in data analytics the Data Scientist is also expected to coordinate, strategize and guide the company officers performing data analytics work to achieve efficiency and accuracy.
Data Analysis & Model Development
Research and develop statistical and machine learning models for comprehensive data analysis
Utilize algorithms and models to mine big data, perform data and error analysis, and ensure data uniformity and accuracy
Apply data mining techniques and perform statistical analysis to generate insights at scale
Collaboration & Solution Development
Work closely with both internal and external stakeholders to understand analytic needs and develop effective solutions
Create machine learning-based tools or processes, such as recommendation engines, and monitor their performance through A/B testing and predictive capabilities
Communicate analytic solutions to stakeholders and implement necessary improvements to operational systems
Innovation & Capability Building
Identify relevant structured and unstructured data sources for mining meaningful insights
Build prototype analysis pipelines iteratively to provide scalable insights
Contribute to building data analytics capabilities across the organization, emphasizing the strategic value of data in achieving business objectives
Location:
Near Paya Lebar MRT

Salary:
$5100 to $7500

What we are looking for
Tertiary qualification in a quantitative discipline such as Computer Science, Economics, Statistics, or Applied Mathematics.
3-8 years of experience in computer science, applied mathematics, or other quantitative/computational disciplines.
Proven experience in data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau) and data analysis/processing tools (e.g., R, Python).
Experience with Cloud Technology (e.g., AWS data and analytics Tech Stack) and distributed computing tools (e.g., Hadoop/Spark).
Demonstrated ability in building machine learning models at scale, using real-time data pipelines on platforms.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to communicate complex quantitative analysis in a clear, precise, and actionable manner.
Proficiency in data engineering, including SQL and manipulating structured and unstructured data sources for analysis.
Advanced skills in pattern recognition and predictive modeling.
Experience or specialization in fraud prevention/detection, compliance, forensics, or Jobs and Skills related analysis will be considered advantageous.
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with a strong emphasis on collaboration and innovation.
Candidates without the required qualification but possess the relevant work experience are welcome to apply.
Successful candidates will be offered a 2-year contract.

Job Description:
About MyrLabs
MyrLabs is an A*STAR spin-off that creates cutting edge hardware and algorithms. The MyrLabs team consists of driven and multi-disciplinary engineers dedicated to bringing game-breaking solutions for our partners by innovating at the PCB, firmware, and software levels. We work on problems that academia fears to, cannot, or will not address. These are problems that are difficult and require multi-disciplinary efforts. Our approach focuses on the use of non-mainstream techniques to spark creativity and to solve problems in ways that are not seen before.

Job Brief
We are looking to hire a Country Coordinator to assist the Senior Management Team in opening, building up, and operating an overseas office. The Country Coordinator will have to establish a formal presence of MyrLabs at the overseas locale, build relationships with key corporate partners, and coordinate activities by MyrLabs’ operations teams in-country.
The overseas office will be in Bali, Indonesia. The purpose of the office is to provide local support for MyrLabs’ projects in delivering hardware and software solutions. The workload is expected to start out light and ramp up slowly over the next 1-2 years. You are expected to spend at least 50% (183 days) of your time at the overseas office. You will be supported by MyrLabs staff who will fly in from Singapore on 1- or 2-week stints. The initial workload will be light and ramp up over the next 1-2 years as the team expands and more local staff are hired. We are open to flexible part-time work, but request that you remain contactable during work hours especially when a MyrLabs team is in-country. If you do not already speak Bahasa Indonesia, you are expected to learn it and achieve conversational fluency within 6 months.
Our ideal candidate has:
· Demonstratable congeniality and is comfortable with Singaporean working culture
· Proven experience in managing and executing projects and/or technology deployments
· Proven business acumen in solving business problems and soliciting new problems
· Career stints in government and/or R&D roles

Responsibilities
1. Act as the primary representative of MyrLabs in-country with a focus on building and maintaining relationships with key stakeholders
2. Work with the Senior Management Team to design and execute strategies that are suitable and friendly to the local environment
3. Oversee the day-to-day operations, ensuring high standards of delivery across all projects and services in compliance with local regulations within manageable operational risks
4. Foster, mentor, and guide MyrLabs staff (mostly Millennials and Gen-Z’ers) whenever they operate in-country

Stance on Silver Jobs
MyrLabs is open to seniors who are near-retirement or seeking continuing work to apply for the role.

Stance on Skills-based Hiring
MyrLabs has pledged support for the skills-based hiring movement; candidates are assessed based on a ‘skills first’ approach and relevant experience over qualifications.

After application, please send your resume, MBTI profile, and any other relevant document to careers@myrlabs.com

Job Description:
About the role
As a Senior Delivery Manager, you’ll play a pivotal role in delivering large-scale, high-impact projects from start to finish. You’ll lead cross-functional teams, manage key stakeholders, and navigate complex challenges to ensure projects are completed on time, within scope, and to the highest quality standards. You’ll be a strategic thinker with a hands-on leadership approach, driving operational success and continuous improvement.

• Lead End-to-End Delivery: Oversee the full project lifecycle, from planning to execution, ensuring timely and on-budget delivery of exceptional products and services.
• Stakeholder Collaboration: Work closely with internal teams (product, engineering, operations) to align on project goals, timelines, and priorities.
• Risk & Issue Management: Proactively identify and mitigate risks, resolving challenges quickly to maintain project momentum.
• Optimize Resources: Efficiently manage project plans, timelines, and resources to ensure that deliverables meet expectations.
• Process Improvement: Continuously refine project management practices to increase efficiency, reduce risks, and improve outcomes.
• Quality Assurance: Ensure all project deliverables meet high standards and are fully validated before delivery.
• Financial Stewardship: Manage project budgets and provide regular updates to senior leadership.
• Post-Delivery Support: Oversee post-project evaluations and ensure that lessons learned are applied to future initiatives.
What We’re Looking For
7+ years in project delivery, with 3+ years in a leadership role, managing complex technology projects.
Expertise in Agile, Waterfall, or Hybrid project management methodologies, and tools (e.g., Jira, MS Project).
Proven ability to lead cross-functional teams, manage client relationships, and drive results in fast-paced environments.
Strong financial acumen, with experience managing project budgets and forecasts.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to present to senior leadership and stakeholders clients.
A problem-solver with a strategic mindset and a hands-on approach to execution.
· It would be advantageous if you have:
A Master’s degree or relevant certifications (e.g., PMP, Scrum Master).
Familiarity with Lean, Six Sigma, or other continuous improvement methodologies.
Experience with change management and driving organisational transformation.

Job Title: Low Latency Network Engineer (24 Months Contract)
Job Description:
Low Latency Network Engineer (Ultra Low\Low Latency Data Centre)
As a Network Engineer you'll provide solutions across the company's datacenters and global colocation estate across the world encompassing all aspects related to collocation sites: site access, equipment procurement, logistics, capacity management (power, space, servers, network ports, etc.), performance management, service availability, connectivity, compute and market data delivery.

You will architect, engineer and deploy ultra-low latency network infrastructure including overseeing and carrying-out installation, monitoring, maintenance, support, optimization and documentation of all network hardware, security hardware, software and connectivity. You will also get involved with managing\participating in multiple projects and be responsible for configuring / optimizing the network to ensure ultra-low\low latency is achieved for intraday trading and direct market access systems, providing exchange, broker and managed service providers connectivity to support market data delivery and order execution.

Requirements:
20+ years in the relevant field and/or experience
Strong knowledge on Electronic and Algo Trading Platforms, Feed Handlers, Order Routers, Smart Order Routers, FIX protocol.
Exchange binary FIX protocols such as OUCH, ITCH.
Strong Network engineering and project delivery experience
Advanced knowledge of routing and switching protocols;
Experience with Unicast: EIGRP, OSPF, BGP, NAT, IPSEC and GRE
Heavy experience with Multicast: PIM, RP, MSDP, IGMP v2, v3
Experience with Switching: STP, PC/vPC/MLAG, CDP/LLDP, QoS, HSRP/VRRP, VLAN/VxLAN, Spine and Leaf infrastructures.
In-depth experience with Cisco Nexus network switching, routing hardware and software
Knowledge of network monitoring PCAP decoding tools landscape (Corvil, SFlow, timestamping (PTP) preferred but not required)
Knowledge of Algorithmic/DMA/HFT and trading platforms and how the trade lifecycle operates
Solid understanding of market venue, exchange protocols (binary, FIX, ITCH,OUCH, Pillar, etc.) and trading systems across multiple asset classes
Strong scripting and automation experience (Python preferred but not required)
Excellent communication skills; ability to perform under pressure and detail oriented
While certification are interesting, they are not required as we value experience over certification

Job Description:
Job Description (Roles & Responsibilities)
Serve as a key technical member of the Solutions Architecture team in helping to enable partners and ensure partner success in building partner practice, capabilities, and solutions on the Huawei Cloud platform.
Scope each partner engagement, with attention towards clear and well-defined objectives and success criteria.
Provide the architectural guidance and recommendations necessary to promote successful partner engagements validating POCs, SOWs, new solutions and architecture designs.
Demonstrate vision, creativity, business acumen and deep Huawei Cloud knowledge in jointly developing industry and vertical partner solutions.
Own each technical enablement and engagement, and help ensure a timely and successful delivery of value. (delivery of actual solutions to be done by Huawei partners)
Capture and share best-practice knowledge amongst the solution architect community.
Understand the Huawei market segments, customer base, and industry verticals.
Understand and exploit internal Huawei systems.
Share partner and customer feedback to internal product management and engineering teams to help drive improvements.
As a Partner Solution Architect focused on our strategic alliance partners within Huawei Cloud, you will have the opportunity to help shape and take initiative to produce results on a strategy to build mind share and broad use of the Huawei Cloud platform across our partner community.
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS
Be familiar with the functions, principles, and architecture of one or more domains of the public cloud or private cloud. Basic programming knowledge or development experience is preferred.
Highly technical and analytical, possess 8+ years of current solution architecture (implementation/consulting) experience
Experience in technology/software sales or pre-sales consulting.
Presentation skills with a high degree of comfort speaking with executives, IT Management, and developers
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Experience in working within partner and consulting organizations
Experience in migrating or transforming legacy customer solutions to the cloud
Experience with Huawei Cloud is a plus
Experience in programming or scripting language is a plus.

About the Client
Our client is one of the reputed MNC firms in Singapore
Responsibilities
Functional specification

b. Collaborate with Functional Business Analyst to clarify functional and non-functional requirements.

Technical Design
a. Responsible to create technical design.

• Commitment.

• A strong & assertive communicator in speaking & writing. Analytical mindset and good problem solving skills.

Job Description:
Security Infrastructure Analyst
Main Duties
As an expert of his/her team, he/she:
assigns technical tasks and manages delegation for technical issues,
animates the team to encourage collaboration and sharing of best practices,
has a role in supporting technical skills development and provides training when required,
supports new technologies and leverages them to provide consistency of service across streams,
manages service improvements for all Network and Security services supported throughout the organization,
documents,reviews, maintains and shares relevant technical information to the team
provides technical direction, supports services both proactively and reactively to maintain the availability and reliability of system infrastructure in accordance with the SLA,
implements and develops improvements based on best practices,
focuses on automation and optimum use of the team to improve efficiency,
drives and delivers root cause for any high severity issue,
reviews technology changes to identify potential risks,
is responsible for problem management and resolution

Respond to user incident reports and evaluates the type and severity of security events.
Identify recurring security issues and risks and develops mitigation plans and recommends process improvements.
Interpret and apply security policies and procedures.
Establish escalation processes for security incidents and develops contingency plans and disaster recovery procedures.
As an experienced professional in Network-Security Services, he/she:
supports his/her team during diagnosis when technical issues rise in his/her scope of expertise,
is aware of the global IT structure so that he/she anticipates interrelationships within the organization,
engages with technical peer, Service managers, Architect and project teams on technology roadmap and projects,
facilitates transformation projects and suggest future directions for new areas of improvement and change,
guarantees the production readiness and license to operate of new projects and solutions
is available and able to drive technically, any complex or high severity incidents that occur within the scope of their role,

15+ years of Experience in managing network and security infra.

10+ years Experience in handling Firewalls/IPS/F5/Pulse/Proxies, Routers/Switches.
